thread.title: Confident Collectors Snap Up $1 Billion of Art in London

author: Kelly Crow
title: Confident Collectors Snap Up $1 Billion of Art in London
text:
New York’s major spring auctions are still two months away, but a successful series of sales that just concluded in London suggests that collectors know what they want: More.

Snapping up jewel-tone modern paintings, wiry sculptures and recently completed works, bidders went on a shopping spree, buying more than $1 billion worth of impressionist, modern and contemporary art all told from Sotheby’s, Christie’s and Phillips in London. That’s up 27% from a similar round of sales a year ago and a sign that collector confidence...
